documents.title: Discussion on additional study of AI/ML for CSI compression
documents.summary: This document discusses the ongoing studies and agreements related to the use of AI/ML for CSI compression in the NR air interface. It outlines the objectives for enhancing CSI feedback, including improving the trade-off between performance and complexity, and addressing inter-vendor training collaboration issues. The document details various agreements reached in previous meetings regarding the evaluation of temporal domain aspects of AI/ML-based CSI compression, including categorization for study, baseline options for UE distribution, and evaluation assumptions. It also presents results from simulations using different model architectures, highlighting the performance gains achieved through the use of past samples in the encoder and decoder. Furthermore, the document discusses inter-vendor collaboration options, emphasizing the need for standardized signaling for parameter and dataset exchanges. The conclusions summarize observations and proposals for future directions in the study of AI/ML for CSI compression.

working_groups.name: RAN Working Group 1
working_groups.description: Working group focused on radio access network specifications and studies.

references.details: Revised WID on Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML) for NR Air Interface, Qualcomm, RAN#105, Melbourne, Australia, September 9-12, 2024.
Study on Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML) for NR air interface (Release 18), V2.0.0 (2023-12).
Final summary of Additional study on AI/ML for NR air interface: CSI compression, Moderator (Qualcomm), 3GPP TSG RAN WG1 #116-bis, Changsha, China, April 15th – April 19th, 2024.
Chair's Notes RAN1#118, Maastricht, NL, August 19th – 23th, 2024.
Chairman's Notes RAN1#117, Fukuoka City, Fukuoka, Japan, May 20th – 24th, 2024.
